notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Lacunae after folios 3 and 6, and quires 17-20 are entirely lost. Stained.
Folios 270r-270v - contains doodles, magical squares, etc. Yosef ben Mosheh: inscribed, folio 1v. Mosheh Firūz Ḳara᾿i: inscribed, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Arabic commentary on the weekly sections Be-shalaḥ, Yitro and Mishpaṭim (Exodus 13:17-24:18).

collation.p: Originally 32 quires of 10 leaves each, with exception of 8th and 9th which have 11 and 8 leaves respectively). Signatures in Hebrew letters on the left-hand upper corner of the first page of a quire are found on folios 63r, 74r, 82r, 92r, 102r, 112r, 122r, 142r, 152r.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square and semi-cursive script of 13 to 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Caraite Commentary on Exodus. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2398.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881, folio [271v].
